title: How to Grow Chicory

steps.headline: Sow seeds or seedlings in a sunny spot.
steps.description: The soil should be humus rich, moist, and well drained.

steps.headline: Apply a liquid fertiliser fortnightly (every two weeks).
Thin the seedlings.
steps.description: When the seedlings are well established, thin them. They should be about 20 centimeter (7.9 in) to 30 centimeter (11.8 in) apart.

steps.headline: Harvest.
steps.description: The leaves will be ready for harvesting about 60 to 70 days from planting.

steps.headline: Serve in salads.

text: Obtain seeds or seedlings.  Sow seeds or seedlings in a sunny spot. The soil should be humus rich, moist, and well drained. Water regularly.  Apply a liquid fertiliser fortnightly (every two weeks).  Thin the seedlings. When the seedlings are well established, thin them. They should be about 20 centimeter (7.9 in) to 30 centimeter (11.8 in) apart. Harvest. The leaves will be ready for harvesting about 60 to 70 days from planting. Serve in salads. Chicory has a slightly bitter taste that is very enjoyable. The blue flowers can be added to salad. These appear in late spring and summer.
